memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t cid, uint8_t objId[OTP_VFS_OBJECT_ID_LEN], uint8_t attType, uint8_t *att, uint8_t attLen)
memberdef.name: OtpVFSSetAttributeUi

briefdescription.para: Sets the specified attribute for the selected object in the Object Server.

detaileddescription.para: This function sets the specified attribute for the selected object in the Object Server based on the attribute type and the provided data. It performs validation checks and updates the object's metadata accordingly.

parameterdescription.para: Connection ID for the current connection.
Object ID of the selected object.
Attribute type to be set.
Pointer to the attribute data.
Length of the attribute data.

simplesect.para:
The result of the attribute setting operation. Possible return values include:
ATT_SUCCESS if the attribute is successfully set.
ATT_OTP_ERR_WRITE_REQ_REJ if the write request is rejected.
ATT_OTP_ERR_OBJ_NOT_SELECTED if the object is not selected.
ATT_OTP_ERR_NAME_ALREADY_EXISTS if the name already exists.
ATT_OTP_ERR_WRITE_REQ_REJ for other invalid write requests.

briefdescription.para: Create an entry in the OTP VFS core.

parameterdescription.para: Size of the entry to be created.

simplesect.para: Handle for the created entry, or OTP_VFS_CORE_INVALID_HANDLE if creation fails.

briefdescription.para: Create a read request to retrieve data from a specified range within an object.

parameterdescription.para: Connection ID.
Offset within the object's data where the read operation should start.
Length of the data range to be read.

simplesect.para: OTP_VFS_OACP_ERR_SUCCESS if the request is successful, or an error code if the operation failed.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint16_t hdl, uint32_t offset, uint8_t *buff, uint32_t len)
memberdef.name: OtpVFSCoreRead

briefdescription.para: Read data from the OTP VFS core.

parameterdescription.para: Handle for the entry.
Offset within the entry to start reading.
Pointer to the buffer to store the read data.
Length of the data to read.

simplesect.para: The number of bytes successfully read.

briefdescription.para: Delete an entry from the OTP VFS core.

parameterdescription.para: Handle for the entry to be deleted.

simplesect.para: Handle of the deleted entry or OTP_VFS_CORE_INVALID_HANDLE if unsuccessful.

briefdescription.para: Read data from the OTP VFS core and calculate CRC32.

parameterdescription.para: Handle for the entry.
Offset within the entry to start reading.
Length of the data to read and calculate CRC32.

simplesect.para: The CRC32 value calculated from the read data.

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t cid, uint32_t length, uint32_t offset, uint8_t *pBuff)
memberdef.name: OtpVFSWriteData

briefdescription.para: Write data to the current object in the OTP VFS.

parameterdescription.para: Connection ID for the current connection.
Length of the data to be written.
Offset at which to start writing the data.
Pointer to the data to be written.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, or an error code on failure.

briefdescription.para: Initiate an abort operation request for the current OACP Read operation in progress.

parameterdescription.para: Connection ID for the current connection.

simplesect.para:
OTP_VFS_OACP_ERR_SUCCESS if the abort operation request is successfully initiated, or an error code if the operation cannot be initiated. Possible error codes include:
OTP_VFS_OACP_ERR_NOT_SUPPORTED when the abort feature is not supported.
OTP_VFS_OACP_ERR_OPERATION_FAILED when an operation is not in progress or cannot be aborted.

briefdescription.para: Handle the abort of the current read operation.

parameterdescription.para: Channel identifier.

briefdescription.para: Performs an Object Access Control Point (OACP) operation on objects in the Object Transfer Protocol (OTP) Service.

detaileddescription.para: This function performs an OACP operation on objects in the OTP Service based on the provided operation code.

parameterdescription.para: Connection ID for the current connection.
Length of the OACP operation data.
Pointer to the buffer containing the OACP operation data.
Pointer to the variable to store the OACP operation response.

simplesect.para:
The result of the OACP operation. Possible return values include:
ATT_SUCCESS if the OACP operation is successfully executed.
ATT_OTP_ERR_WRITE_REQ_REJ if the write request is rejected.

briefdescription.para: Create a request to calculate the CRC checksum for a specified range of data within an object.

parameterdescription.para: Connection ID.
Offset within the object's data where CRC calculation should start.
Length of the data range for CRC calculation.

simplesect.para: OTP_VFS_OACP_ERR_SUCCESS if the request is successful, or an error code if the operation failed.

briefdescription.para: Get the checksum of the currently selected object in the OTP VFS list.

parameterdescription.para: Connection ID.

simplesect.para: Checksum of the currently selected object.

briefdescription.para: Add a new UUID to the blacklist for a specific connection.

parameterdescription.para: Object Transfer Channel ID.
Pointer to the UUID to add to the blacklist.
Flag indicating if the UUID is 128 bits long.

simplesect.para: true if the UUID is successfully added to the blacklist, false otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Print information about objects in the OTP VFS for the specified connection.

parameterdescription.para: Connection ID for the current connection.

briefdescription.para: Set the availability status of a specified channel.

parameterdescription.para: Channel ID.
true to set the channel as available, false to set as unavailable.

briefdescription.para: Get the availability status of a specified channel.

parameterdescription.para: Channel ID.
true if the channel is available, false if it is unavailable.

briefdescription.para: Update the object list based on filters for a specific connection ID.

detaileddescription.para: This function moves the old filtered objects to the usedId list and filters them again based on the specified conditions.

parameterdescription.para: Connection ID.

briefdescription.para: Virtual filesystem implementation for OTP, OTS. Includes functions to handle objects stored in memory.
